Although their drip is of the self-serve, large batch variety, they use good, Counter-Culture beans, and take enough care in the process the brew isn't over extracted, preserving essential character of the roast is maintained, with bright overtones of tropical fruit and citrus coming through clearly on most days. Espressos are well-pulled and highly concentrated; again, the beans make all the difference. The coffee (and comestibles) are expensive (3.25 for a large drip or toddy-brewed iced coffee, 2.75 for espresso), but you're paying for a quality cup, for the convenient location and for the luxury of knowing that you're drinking one of the best cups of coffee in the Financial District, instead of the over roasted swill from one of the legions of Peets and Starbucks.

Four Stars: Good location, good coffee, high prices, next to the express bus.

Extras: 

Did I mention its closeness to the express lines?  Specifically Nx, 2, 3, 8x, 76x, 1ax, 1bx, 30x, 31ax, 31bx, 38ax, 38bx, and 81x? Thats an almost pornographic number of "x"es

Also close to GGT 2, 4, 8, 18, and 24.

Soft serve (uncaffinated) available.
author: Casey U.

description: Dope Almond Croissants!
author: Jeff B.

description:
I like this spot a lot... it's super hipster, not that I mind. 

The service is awesome. Everyone is really nice and friendly. The lines in the morning are always long and this place fills up more since their popularity has grown.

I'm a little sad because every time I go there, they run out of almond milk. There's not many places that make lattes with almond milk, but this one does (when they have it in stock).
author: Jeannie L.

description: Great smooth coffee with fast sevice. They have delious big pastries to go with your coffee. The decor is beautiful and the lighting is great as it is beautiful spheres. The coffee has a real smooth taste and you can tell it is light roasted too a certain point. Its just beautiful surroundings,fast service ans smooth coffee. Definitely going to be a regular.
author: P C.

description: Best in the district. They have baristas who know how to pull an espresso shot, milk alternatives are plentiful and they have a friendly staff. So glad I found this place.
author: Avery B.

description: Great coffee, great service. Definitely lacks the high brow blue bottle vibe, and to be honest has better coffee. Good selection of freshly roasted take home beans as well.
author: Derek D.

description:
Simple, great coffee! The croissants are absolutely to die for.

My go-to breakfast spot in FiDi :)
author: Akshaya M.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood Coffee Cultures. Happy to see you here and I will be visiting often. I really enjoyed your pastries. It would have normally been a 4 star to start with but bumping to a 5 after seeing you give complimentary desserts to some of other employees in the building. A good deed deserves another.
author: Sunil R.

description:
LOOOOOOOVE this place! First off, they have excellent pastry options from a bunch of local shops around SF. They also have fan-tastic tamales that are on my lunch menu often. Im not a giant coffee drinker, but their Vanilla lattes are excellent and made from high quality ingredients. 

The owners and long time employees there are awesome to interact with and one of the reason I come back. They had 1 female barista in the past that was less than pleasant, however, I don't see her in there anymore. She just couldn't seem to crack a smile in the morning! I think they know that people still want (and deserve) friendly customer service when you're paying top dollar for your food and/or beverage. Hopefully they continue to hire people who are the same creative types as the owners but also have a good attitude.  Thumbs up to Coffee Cultures - definetly my favorite in the financial district! :)
author: Katherine B.

description:
Fantastic new coffee shop in FiDi!

Consistently great espresso. Quick and friendly service. Worth a few minutes to enjoy a real third wave cappuccino on the way to work (even though it is a few blocks out of my way).  Pleased to see another option for truly excellent coffee in downtown SF.
author: Mary W.

description:
I ran into this place on my way back from lunch and saw the super trendy sign on the outside. I swear I know every coffee spot around my work - so I HAD to walk into this place since I've never heard of it before. 

The environment is super hip and trendy, like a coffee shop should be in San Francisco! I had no idea what to order, so the guy working there (which btw, also matched the trendy ambiance) recommended an iced, almond milk, cardamom latte. I did tell him that I like strong tasting coffee, but when I got the coffee it was too milky for me. Totally not his fault though, how would he know what "strong" means, since it probably means something different to everyone he talks to. 

So, at this point I probably would've rated this place a 2 because of my lack-of-tasting-coffee but then we ran into one of the owners (which btw, started Coffee Bar) and he asked me how my coffee could be improved! Really awesome that they take constructive criticism, especially for a new business! So okay, that conversation totally saved them from a "2" rating to a "4" rating - bravo Coffee Cultures! Good save.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Excellent spot for a coffee in the area. Even with Blue Bottle and Phil'z nearby, I prefer the low-key vibe here and no obscene lines spilling onto the street. The coffee is delicious, and they have a cute little bar you can sit at and enjoy the world going by outside. I like to meet friends here for afternoon coffee on workdays.
author: Michelle L.

description: I grabbed coffee here at around 2:30 on a Thursday afternoon, and there was a line out the door. After drinking their Americano, I can totally see why. Good espresso and knowledgeable staff. This place is pretty no nonsense, with no real seating in the cafe itself. I was overall pretty pleased with my experience.
author: Laura M.

description: Right by the Bush and Sansome bus-stop that I hop off at for work, I've come to Coffee Cultures often enough. Though not as close to me as Coffee Bar I sometimes decide to shake it up and head over for a Gibraltar or a latte, and they don't disappoint.  Usually the service is fast and I'm in and out quickly enough, and the quality of espresso and their barista skills make it more than good enough by FiDi standards.
author: Chloe B.

description: Coffee done right.  Fast service, high quality coffee and baristas that know what they are doing.
author: Michael S.

description: Been there twice and both times they have messed up my orders. The first time I paid for a double espresso and was only given a single. The second time I ordered a soy pumpkin spice latte, and as I watched her make it, it looked like it was not made with soy milk. I pointed to the carton she used and she said, "yeah, that's soy," like I'm an idiot. About half way through the drink I am realizing it is definitely not soy.. I go back down there to say something and looked at the carton again...it was WHOLE milk she used. I never make a big deal about incorrect orders, but she blatantly lied to my face so she wouldn't have to make a new one. I don't drink soy because it's trendy, I legit can't have lactose. I expected better from a place with over-priced coffee. If you're still going to go here, make sure you watch them make the drinks.
author: Almeta R.

description: Love getting a quad with four shots of espresso!  They are super nice here and cool
author: Laura M.

description: Great service and location but the Vietnamese Iced Coffee tasted horrible. I think the condensed milk went back or something =(
author: Tiff W.

description: I got the 16oz coffee of the day which was Columbian something-something-something. Nice and pleasing cup that gave me a much needed jolt. Three dollars is a bit steep, but I felt was worthy. This place is fairly new in FiDi. Limited bar seats for the yuppies mingling with the indie-hip baristas. Cool indie-rock music piping in (reminded of my college days), but I had to switch to my iPhone (kpop 4Minute playlist).
author: Derek N.

description:
This review is long overdue! Actually, it is quite appropriate, as today is my 1 year anniversary that I sold my soul to Corporate America, I mean, I got a job working in the financial district. The one thing I have to look forward to everyday (and have this entire past year since I discovered this gem) is Counter Culture Coffee, on the daily (sometimes multiple times a day) I will order a macchiato for here, and sip it outside and people watch until it is time to go back to work. 

The ambiance of this place is rustic, yet inviting (even though there are only bar style seating and some seating outside). It is often busy, but the people who work here are amazing, fast, professional, and know how to make a damn fine cup of coffee (yes that is a Twin Peaks reference). Shout out to Melissa, Taylor, Cody (used to work there), Justin, and girl with bangs and dark hair (I'm horrible and cannot remember your name) for being awesome :) 

Their coffee is fresh and gets shipped to them quite frequently from their roastery, which I believe is in North Carolina. I typically buy a bag of their beans to take home with me and enjoy over the weekend. I have never been disappointed. I am a big fan of the pour over style-this is how I make my coffee at home so it is nice to see that they are doing this in house. Other great things include: all the pastries, Gibraltars, and cappuccinos. I have yet to try their tamales, but have heard amazing things about them.

Best coffee shop in this area by far. Be there or be square.
author: Megan S.

description:
Good coffee with bad service.

I have enjoyed coming to Coffee Cultures since it opened because the coffee is good, and despite the poor service you get from hipster baristas. I have recently blacklisted them since enough is enough. I had the audacity to ask to have the cappuccino cup replaced since the one they were planning to serve me in had a stain. I got the lecture about "stain is not dirt" and a big show about how annoying I am to make such unreasonable demands.

In summary, pretty good coffee with crappy service/servers.
author: Oleg P.

description: Tiny place outside 255 Bush, I totally support small coffee shops unlike your main stream brew house. They use GOOD quality beans, seating is limited especially when it rains as they loose the outside seating. Grab you cup and Go, support local and good coffee.
author: Shadi K.

description: Best espresso in the financial district. Great service.  Great location and the selection is good too. Ask for the Apollo espresso, but the Toscana is great too.
author: Tom A.

description: Good Coffee and an excellent Croissant started my day visiting the new SF office. This place is very convenient to all the FiDiers, has plenty of outdoor seating and a friendly staff. The coffee was very good (I had a decaf Americano so not too telling). The croissant was rich and buttery, but delicately crunchy. I will be back next time I am at our SF Office!
author: Madison O.

description: I would give this place no stars if that was an option.  It was the worst cappuccino ever!  It was extremely watered down, I could barley taste the coffee and it was sour.  The place looks crowded and has a long wait because it is small and it takes forever to get coffee, NOT because it is good.  The only positive part of my experience was the cookie.
author: Sweta P.

description: This place is very cozy. In the morning when I get my whole milk cappuccino, there is always a line, but it moves quite fast. The service here is friendly and professional. Cappuccinos here are first rate. A bit on the wet side, but that seems to be this place's strength.
author: Wilfred W.

description: The baristas are really nice and I do enjoy counter culture's coffee a good bit.  However, if you are looking for a place to sit and enjoy your coffee, this is not the place to go to.
author: Johnathan W.

description: Mocha and a ham & cheese croissant. Yes, I'm a fat kid.
author: Liz W.

description: BF ordered an ice coffee and gave it a thumbs up. If he says its good. I believe it.
author: Kristen C.

description: First time there today, very disappointed!  First, only one size, so if you want a larger or smaller than their 12 oz, then you're out of luck. Line was not handled well, they skipped around me, I was clearly there.  The Mocha was not hot, not chocolately, not strong coffee.  Want me to try again, Coffee Cultures?  Better reach out!  I could be there daily from my office.
author: Steve G.

description: I consider myself a coffee enthusiast... have had coffee from most of the well known local roasters (Sightglass, Four Barrel, Verve, Blue Bottle)  . Without any hesitation whatsoever this place is hands down the best espresso anywhere. The coffee itself is fantastic... but what takes this place to a new level is the talented baristas. If you don't like the coffee here,  then you're probably used to crap like Starbucks or Folgers
author: Jonathan P.

description: Very disappointed! Completely ignored me! Got my drink and it had spilled on the counter but there was no sort of let me clean that up right away attitude. And to make things worse they watered down my drink that it tasted terrible!
author: Sonia B.

description: The foam, the foam! It is amazing in their lattes. I love their almond milk lattes and like the vibe in this tiny little shop. You can pay on your mobile phone too which is convenient.
author: Nisa C.

description: Coffee has gotten a little better but, like some of the workers' personalities there, is inconsistent. That said, a few guys there really do shine and they should probably be running the place. Or get fat raises.
author: BleepBloop P.

description: Only been there once and the people there are quite friendly & full of personality/color. I like that, especially in homogenous FiDi. The cashier played w my infant which he appreciated.  Interestingly this is a east coast North Carolina brand! I like it and it's a nice change from nearby Specialty's and blue bottle. Though it is situated in close quarters and is not ideal for a coffee talk meet-up.
author: Emm C.

description:
Not good coffee at all. I got regular medium roast and it was totally watered down. Worse than 7-11 or McDonalds. I asked the guy and he said  sarcastically "that's what happens when you add cream". Duh!  Obviously I drink coffee everyday.   But it's not supposed to make it taste like crap.  I could tell by the color too that it was really light. 

He said he tried the coffee and it was supposed to be like that.   Well if he's selling coffee like that and he thinks it's good we are never going back. Especially paying premium prices you expect good coffee. This wasn't even decent.
author: CR L.

description: Awesome cappuccinos. Glad to see a Counter Culture shop open up out west.
author: Cameron L.

description: Had the latte and americano, my go to's to judge quality. Both were great. Latte especially creamy, and pretty. Both served super quick, when there was no line.
author: E. W.

description: My new favorite coffee stop in the Financial District. There are plenty of great places nearby, but Coffee Cultures is consistent, fast, and simple. Extra points for having 8 oz to-go cups and a frequent buyer punch card. My short Americano is always extra hot and never watery. Friendly baristas and cool decor as well!
author: Alison S.

description: Outstanding coffees and espresso, in a very well designed cozy space in the fidi. Oh and the baristas are knowledgeable and charming too!
author: Al A.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Love the vibe and the baristas are very friendly. Haven't tried all their brews yet, but the latte I had today was quite good. They also serve pour over... will try next time.
author: Bryan S.

description: Just waited more than 10 minutes for a macchiato when the four customers who were behind me in line got served their lattes promptly. Unacceptable.
author: JP M.

description:
I love Coffee Cultures. I find the quality of coffee in downtown San Francisco lacking so I was very excited when this place opened. I've only had their lattes but they are consistently delicious and the service is quick. The baristas are friendly and have great taste in music as I often find myself Shazaming while I'm in there.  As a bonus they have a stamp card so every 11th drink is free. 

Coffee Cultures is #1!
author: Zoe M.

description: The guys here are awesome and very friendly. $2.50 for a 12 ounce cup of coffee. The coffee is good. We went later in the morning and there was no wait. My colleague really likes the espresso here.
author: Bling L.

description: delicious smelling whole beans, clover stronetta farms milk
author: J C.

description: This coffee shop has the best coffee and the best muffins I have ever had (please try the Strawberry, Lavender, Chocolate). On top of that, they have absolutely unbelievable service, which is very hard to find from San Francisco coffee shops. For a place that doesn't even really have seating, this is the best coffee experience I have had in the Financial District, maybe even in the City all together.
author: Alex S.

description: Cute little shop.  I had the pork tamale for $4.25 and thought it tasted great.
author: K L.

description: Very solid drip coffee; it stands out in a sea of coffee shops nearby. Baked goods and yogurt are also high quality.
author: Steven B.
